definition: to gently caress and stroke/to pet/to fondle
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: Hency stroked Trenven's back and looked into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 汉西抚摸着川文的背，看着天空。

sentences.english: Wear an open shirt, and touch your neck and collarbone.
sentences.chinese: 穿一件开襟衬衫，抚摸自己的脖子和锁骨。

sentences.english: Some cats initially find the sensation of being petted as pleasurable.
sentences.chinese: 有些猫一开始会对抚摸感到愉快。

sentences.english: The tiny little skylark stroked the daisy, and flew away to the wide and blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 小云雀抚摸着小雏菊，带着她飞向广阔的蓝天。

sentences.english: The stone head of the Buddha is polished because many people rub it as they go past.
sentences.chinese: 路过游客不断的抚摸使这个石佛的头部显得亮锃锃的。

sentences.english: "The wind blows ", like mum's hand which is touching you.
sentences.chinese: “吹面不寒杨柳风”，不错的，象母亲的手抚摸着你。

sentences.english: I could feel the dog's thick fur when I petted him.
sentences.chinese: 我抚摸这条狗的时候，觉得它身上毛绒绒的。

sentences.english: And he reached down and touched her - and gave her life.
sentences.chinese: 他俯下身，抚摸着她，给了她生命。

sentences.english: But she continues to caress Sayaka's face.
sentences.chinese: 但她继续抚摸早矢香的脸。

sentences.english: The long slender hand dauts wearing a smile photograph piece of cloud and more sees more sorrowful.
sentences.chinese: 细长的手抚摸着云含笑的张照片，越看越悲伤。

sentences.english: They fondled in the back seat of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐在出租车的后排座位上相互抚摸。

sentences.english: Parents should also offer a touch, Dr. Kazdin says.
sentences.chinese: 卡兹丁博士说，家长还应该配合抚摸动作。
保姆怜爱地抚摸着孩子。

sentences.english: I stroked his hair and headed to the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 我抚摸他的头发，之后向洗手间走去。

sentences.english: Though weak, she caressed the cat and would not allow me to take him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她身体衰弱，但她抚摸它，不让我把猫抱走。

sentences.english: Then it switches to its left paw and begins rubbing the dog's head.
sentences.chinese: 然后用左爪轻轻抚摸雪橇犬的头。

definition: to caress/to fondle/to look after (tenderly)/affectionate care
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
